case_vignette: A 22-year-old man presents to the emergency department with a sore throat. He says his symptoms have persisted for the past several days and have become so severe that he can no longer eat food. The patient has no significant past medical history and is not taking any medications. He is a freshman in college and recently joined a fraternity. The patient drinks 4 to 5 drinks every day of the week and smokes marijuana. His temperature is 100°F (37.8°C), blood pressure is 117/68 mmHg, pulse is 90/min, respirations are 17/min, and oxygen saturation is 98% on room air. Physical exam is notable for the finding in Figure A. Bilateral symmetrical posterior cervical lymphadenopathy and splenomegaly are also noted.
question: Which  is the best next step in management for the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've had a sore throat for the past several days, and it's gotten so bad that I can't eat food anymore.
Have you had any fever or chills?
Yes, I currently have a fever with a temperature of 100°F.
Have you had any cough or difficulty breathing?
I haven't mentioned having a cough or difficulty breathing.
Have you had any recent travel history or exposure to anyone who has been sick?
I haven't mentioned any travel or exposure to sick people.
Have you had any recent changes in your weight or appetite?
I didn't mention any changes in weight, but I can't eat because of my severe sore throat.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns or energy levels?
I didn't mention anything about changes in my sleep or energy levels.
Have you had any recent changes in your menstrual cycle or sexual activity?
I didn't mention anything about my menstrual cycle or sexual activity.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication or supplements?
I'm not taking any medications.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or lifestyle?
I've recently joined a fraternity in college and have been drinking 4 to 5 drinks every day of the week.
Final Diagnosis: Mononucleosis
